item.description:

Bollywood actress Sonakshi Sinha humorously expressed her annoyance towards her husband Zaheer Iqbal‚Äôs antics. Sonakshi recently shared a light-hearted video on Instagram, teasing Zaheer for his behavior.

item.title: Salman Khan Didn't 'Allow' Sangeeta Bijlani To Wear Short Clothes, Actress Says 'I'm Not Afraid Now' - News18
item.description:
Salman Khan Didn't 'Allow' Sangeeta Bijlani To Wear Short Clothes, Actress Says 'I'm Not Afraid Now'

Date & Source: January 01, 2025, 16:30 IST - News18

Sangeeta Bijlani, a former Bollywood actress, recently revealed that during her relationship with Salman Khan, he didn't allow her to wear short clothes.

In an appearance on Indian Idol 15, when asked if she would have changed something in her career, she said, "Jo the na (mimics Salman) humare ex, I was very constricted. Matlab kapde yeh nahi pehanna, itne short nahi hone chahiye. Itna long hona chahiye, voh gale main‚Ä¶ I could not wear this kind of dress. Initially, I did but then I was not allowed to. So I was shy then, abhi main aisi nahi hoon. Abhi poori gundi hoon. I‚Äôm not afraid now, I was reserved then."

  1. Sangeeta Bijlani opens up about her relationship with Salman Khan.
  2. She revealed that Salman didn't allow her to wear short clothes during their relationship.
  3. She mimicked Salman's way of speaking to emphasize her point.
  4. Sangeeta and Salman's relationship lasted nearly a decade and was one of Bollywood's most adored couples.
  5. Despite their breakup, they managed to maintain a cordial and respectful bond.
  6. Sangeeta married cricketer Mohammad Azharuddin in 1996, and they finalized their divorce in 2019.
  7. Sangeeta and Salman remained in touch, showcasing their enduring friendship.
"Connections don‚Äôt break... Connections never go away. The love between your partners, school friends never goes away." - Sangeeta Bijlani

Conclusion: Sangeeta Bijlani shared a personal aspect of her past relationship with Salman Khan, revealing that he didn't allow her to wear short clothes. Despite their breakup, they maintained a friendly bond.

item.title: ‚ÄòVidaa Muyarchi‚Äô was suggested by Ajith Kumar: Magizhi Thirumeni interview - The Hindu
item.description:
Magizh Thirumeni Discusses Directing Ajith Kumar in 'Vidaa Muyarchi'

Published: January 01, 2025 04:44 pm IST

The filmmaker Magizh Thirumeni opens up about his first-time collaboration with superstar Ajith Kumar for the film 'Vidaa Muyarchi', revealing insights into their creative partnership and the risks involved in choosing unconventional storytelling.

  • Magizh Thirumeni has waited over 15 years to direct Ajith Kumar, known for his commercial action films.
  • For the first time, Magizh is directing a film based on someone else's story, as suggested by Ajith.
  • This film marks a departure from Ajith's typical heroic roles, portraying him as a common man.
  • Ajith insists on creating a 'sensible film' rather than following conventional commercial norms.
  • The production faced challenges when Ajith was involved in a car accident during filming in Azerbaijan.
‚ÄúI wouldn‚Äôt go so far as to say that this film is present in a Magizh Thirumeni world...because the source material is not mine,‚Äù - Magizh Thirumeni.

The collaboration is viewed as a significant shift in Tamil cinema, as it embraces a purer genre approach over commercial blending, with high expectations for audience reception.

item.title: Mouni Roy trips and falls on pavement after celebrating New Year with Disha Patani; husband Suraj Nambiar picks her up - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Mouni Roy trips and falls on pavement after celebrating New Year with Disha Patani; husband Suraj Nambiar picks her up

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Mouni Roy took a tumble while exiting a New Year's Party in Mumbai, accompanied by her husband Suraj Nambiar and friend Disha Patani. Surrounded by paparazzi, Mouni lost her balance and fell on the pavement, but Suraj quickly helped her up.

  • Mouni was seen falling while leaving a New Year's party with Suraj and Disha.
  • Suraj held her hand to help her get up as the paparazzi clicked pictures.
  • Fans expressed concern for Mouni and criticized the paparazzi's invasiveness.
  • Mouni and Disha have been friends since participating in The Entertainers Tour together.
  • Mouni's recent work includes a series on Disney+ Hotstar and an upcoming film scheduled for 2025.
‚ÄúHope she is okay.‚Äù

In conclusion, Mouni's fall highlights the challenges celebrities face with paparazzi attention, but also shows the support of friends and family during unexpected situations.

item.title: Sameer Wankhede denies leaking Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs chats, defends Aryan Khan‚Äôs arrest - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Sameer Wankhede denies leaking Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs chats, defends Aryan Khan‚Äôs arrest

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

In a recent interview, Sameer Wankhede, the former Zonal Director of the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), addressed the ongoing controversy surrounding his investigation into Aryan Khan's alleged involvement in a drug racket, defending his actions and responding to various allegations.

  • Wankhede denied leaking chats involving Shah Rukh Khan.
  • He defended his professional conduct during the investigation and the arrest of Aryan Khan.
  • Aryan Khan was released on bail after 25 days in jail and later cleared of all charges.
  • Wankhede faced allegations of receiving a bribe, which he refuted.
  • He emphasized the importance of equal treatment under the law, regardless of fame.
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt think I arrested a kid. At 23, Bhagat Singh gave his life for the country.‚Äù - Sameer Wankhede

In conclusion, Wankhede stated he has no regrets about his role in the case and emphasized his commitment to uphold the law, despite facing significant public and media scrutiny.

item.title: Fashion highlights of 2024 - allkpop
item.description:
Fashion Highlights of 2024

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: allkpop

Various styles became hot topics last year as fashionistas led trends with eye-catching looks, from geek chic to grandpacore. Let‚Äôs revisit the styles that dominated 2024.

  • Geeky Look: A polished appearance with items like slim-fit shirts and glasses.
  • Girl Core Look: A feminine blend of trendy and casual daily fashion.
  • Demeure Look: An elegant style featuring muted colors and refined aesthetics.
  • Grandpa Core Look: Fashion inspired by classic items from grandfather's closet.
‚ÄúGeek but chic.‚Äù - Jang Won-young

The fashion trends of 2024 showcased a diverse range of styles, from playful to sophisticated, highlighting the evolving preferences of fashion enthusiasts.

item.title: Kannada star Shiva Rajkumar is now cancer-free after surgery in US, shares emotional message: 'I'll be back stronger' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shiva Rajkumar Declares Victory Over Cancer in Emotional New Year Message

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heartfelt New Year message, actor and film producer Shiva Rajkumar shared his immense gratitude after successfully battling cancer following surgery in the US.

  • Shiva Rajkumar underwent bladder cancer surgery in December 2024 at the Miami Cancer Institute.
  • He expressed fear prior to diagnosis but attributed his strength to the support of family, friends, and fans.
  • Rajkumar detailed his experience, acknowledging the challenges of chemotherapy and expressing gratitude for his medical team.
  • His wife, Geetha, confirmed the positive outcome of his treatment, stating he is officially cancer-free.
  • The actor expressed optimism about his recovery and plans to take care of himself moving forward.
  • The news of his recovery has significantly uplifted his fans, who had been praying for his health.
"I am eternally grateful for all your love and blessings. Happy New Year! #2025." - Shiva Rajkumar

This inspiring announcement has brought hope and joy not only to his fans but also to many who have faced similar health battles.

item.title: Top Highest Grossing Films in India in 2024: Pushpa 2 rules the top followed by Kalki and Stree 2 - PINKVILLA
item.description:
Top Highest Grossing Films in India in 2024: Pushpa 2 Rules the Top

Updated on Jan 01, 2025 | Pinkvilla

2024 was a mixed year for the Indian box office, highlighted by three mega-hits, including Pushpa 2. The overall performance, however, was subdued, particularly in Bollywood.

  • Pushpa 2 emerged as the highest-grossing film of the year, with projected earnings surpassing Rs. 1375 crore.
  • Kalki 2898 AD and Stree 2 were notable mentions, with Stree 2 becoming the highest-grossing Hindi film ever.
  • Bollywood experienced its worst year, with only six films crossing the Rs. 100 crore mark.
  • Kollywood had disappointing results compared to 2023, with only two films grossing over Rs. 200 crore.
  • Mollywood celebrated a landmark year with a rise in blockbusters.
  • Tollywood improved its performance with two mega blockbusters in Pushpa and Kalki.
"While the year saw three mega-grossers... the overall performance across industries, barring Malayalam and to an extent Telugu, painted a subdued picture."

In conclusion, while 2024 had its successes, it also highlighted the challenges various film industries faced. Looking ahead, 2025 is anticipated to be a better year for releases.

item.title: Is Chennai‚Äôs Margazhi Carnatic fest losing sheen? Empty halls, ageing fans, unpaid artists - ThePrint
item.description:
Waning Enthusiasm for Chennai's Margazhi Carnatic Music Festival

Publication Date & Source: The Print, 29 December 2022

Chennai's annual Margazhi Carnatic music festival, once known for packed halls and NRI crowds, has seen a significant decline in attendance in recent years. The festival, which began on 15 December, was marked by empty halls and struggling organisers, raising concerns about the future of Carnatic music.

  1. Dwindling audiences: Despite the large audience base for Carnatic music, only around 7,000 people could attend the event, with most halls remaining empty except for a few top artists.
  2. Economic impact: The festival's economic contribution is decreasing, with only around Rs 1.68 crore from ticket sales, while canteen sales alone reach Rs 6 crore during the 45-day season.
  3. Artists' income: Many artists go unpaid for their performances, and the audience expects performances to be delivered to their doorstep, further straining the festival's finances.
  4. Lack of expansion: Carnatic music festivals are concentrated in specific areas of Chennai, and there's a lack of effort to expand the art form to other places, leading to a shrinking fan base.
Singer TM Krishna, who returned to the Music Academy after nearly a decade, expressed concern about the decline in music events across the city and stressed the need to revive and reimagine smaller sabhas to ensure Carnatic music's survival.

Also read: Meaningful art doesn‚Äôt have to be complex. Raihan Vadra-curated show defies the norm

item.title: Rajiv Kapoor was addicted to alcohol, Khushbu Sundar says everyone was very worried for him: ‚ÄòWe spoke a day before his death‚Äô - The Indian Express
item.description:
Khushbu Sundar Reflects on Rajiv Kapoor's Struggles with Alcohol Addiction Before His Untimely Death

Publication Date: January 2021 | Source: The Indian Express

Khushbu Sundar reminisces about her close friendship with Rajiv Kapoor, revealing his struggle with alcohol addiction and its impact on his health. She shared their last conversation and acknowledged the shock of his sudden passing.

  • Rajiv Kapoor, brother of Rishi and Randhir Kapoor, passed away at 58 from a heart attack.
  • Khushbu Sundar discussed Rajiv's alcohol addiction and its effects on his overall health.
  • She expressed her feelings of shock upon learning of his death a day after speaking with him.
  • The two shared a friendship that involved regular meals and deep connections.
  • Khushbu lamented about losing touch with Rajiv's family after his passing.
‚ÄúI spoke to Chimpu just a day before his death. He was down with very high fever and during COVID-19 he was taking his health lightly.‚Äù - Khushbu Sundar

Khushbu's reflections highlight the struggles Rajiv faced and the deep bond they shared, revealing the tragic loss of a vibrant person.

item.title: Naga Vamsi says he wasn't disrespectful towards Boney Kapoor: ‚ÄòDon't need to teach us how to respect elders' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Naga Vamsi says he wasn't disrespectful towards Boney Kapoor: ‚ÄòDon't need to teach us how to respect elders'

Date: Jan 01, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

During a recent roundtable chat, producer Naga Vamsi denied claims of disrespect towards Boney Kapoor while discussing the influence of south cinema on Bollywood.

  • Vamsi clarified there was 'no disrespect' during the conversation.
  • He claimed that Boney is more respected in the south than in Bollywood.
  • Vamsi highlighted how south Indian cinema has evolved and influenced Bollywood.
  • The discussion led to social media backlash and critiques from industry peers.
Naga Vamsi stated, ‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt need to teach us how to respect elders, we respect boney ji more than u guys do and there was no disrespect towards boney ji in that conversation‚Ä¶‚Äù

The exchange signals ongoing tensions and dialogues between south Indian cinema and Bollywood, showing a growing recognition of regional influences in the film industry.

item.title: Anurag Kashyap says Bollywood lacks the 'brains' to make a film like Pushpa: ‚ÄòEveryone is trying to create a universe‚Äô - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Anurag Kashyap critiques Bollywood's filmmaking capabilities

Publication Date: Jan 01, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Anurag Kashyap has criticized the Hindi film industry for lacking the creativity and intellect to create films like 'Pushpa: The Rise' and its sequel 'Pushpa 2: The Rule'. He argues that Bollywood is focusing on creating franchises instead of fostering original filmmaking.

  • Kashyap states Bollywood filmmakers lack the necessary skills to create works like 'Pushpa'.
  • Pushpa 2 is recognized as the highest-grossing Indian film of 2024, surpassing ‚Çπ1760 crore globally.
  • Kashyap expresses frustration with the studio model in India that limits creative expression.
  • His recent film 'Kennedy' has been well-received internationally but struggles for a domestic release.
‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt understand anything. They can‚Äôt even make a Pushpa. They cannot, because they don‚Äôt have the brains to make a film.‚Äù - Anurag Kashyap

Kashyap's remarks highlight a growing concern over the state of creativity in Bollywood, suggesting a need for change if filmmakers wish to compete globally.
